content:
The Lightning Knowledge Component helps agents quickly find relevant articles for their cases. It suggests articles based on keyword search and AI analysis of past cases, and allows agents to search, sort, and attach articles. Agents can also follow and unfollow articles to save them for later.

To use the component, add it to a custom Lightning console app or a record's page using the Lightning App Builder. The component is automatically added to sample Service Console pages.

Suggested Articles uses keyword-based search to find relevant articles, while Einstein Article Recommendations analyzes past cases and case-article attaches to find relevant articles based on AI features like term overlap. To show intelligent article suggestions, turn on Einstein Article Recommendations.

Agents can also search knowledge articles using the search box in the component or Advanced Search for pre-filtering. Sorting options include relevance, publish date, last modified date, A to Z, and Z to A.

To attach an article to a case, select it from the dropdown next to the article. Agents can also follow and unfollow an article using the same dropdown.

Administrators, agents, and internal employees with read access to Knowledge can follow articles in any state, such as published or draft. To enable feed tracking, go to Setup | Chatter | Feed Tracking.

The component helps agents find relevant knowledge articles for their cases, and allows them to share articles in case emails and other channels by inserting article text or links.
title: Service Cloud Lightning Knowledge Component
